3m1xpbXnXY8j5-wC-QrLRA.text: The avocado stack app was good. Ordered the salmon and had it blackened. It was good. The creme brulee corn was amazing. The ribeye had a lot of fat. I did have one of the best dirty martinis I've ever had there. The Moscow mule didn't suit my tastes.

MUN0FVsTwCXaS8oSCB8SWA.text: Best. Steak. Ever. - Pretty much sums it up. The food is amazing, the service is always spot on, & their bathrooms are perfect. Doesn't get any better than Steak 44. Take the person you love & neither of you will be disappointed.

_juVivjWM6P5HcLTXSpR9Q.text: Excellent happy hour choice - try the crispy shrimp appetizer and 2 lemon martinis - quality and taste of shrimp are amazing - large martini is indescribably good - servers are all excellent -"service is 1st class - 4 drinks and 2 large - meal size - shrimp appetizers - $60

oZiTbg2pTSz6C7-AMUmurg.text: Lots of things were really good such as the hot bread, potatoes with cheese and onions, creamed spinach, and yummy red velvet bread pudding....DELICIOUS! but the most important part of the dinner, the main dish, was mediocre...I had the scallops, and they were somewhat small and a bit on the salty side....good, but not great for the price! My husbands bone in ribeye was good and cooked properly

zra3wHlWr1Q4yfunYp74kg.text: Great service, great food.  I wasnt fond of our seating area as we were right next to a service station so was constantly hearing staff discuss restaurant operations.  However I guess I just should've asked to move.  One of the best in AZ

_AxYcgI57tomjMO0E0_hEA.text: This is a great "special occasion" splurge. Yes it is expensive but the staff and the food make it all worthwhile. Don't go just for the food, go for the attention to detail that makes 'eating out' completely different from 'dining out'. The bar was mobbed and looked fun. But we wanted a quieter dinner to celebrate and we were seated in a small space with only 2 other tables. That was totally our speed. My advice is to talk to them when you make your reservations and seek out the vibe you want. In the bar is lively and loud, in some of the other spaces, quieter. Some better for romance and some better for business clients.

5x98F_suVgSuL4yFWR0r1g.text: Steak 44 was hands down the best meal we have had in a long time. Steaks were perfectly cooked and the sides sounded so good we ordered three of them and they did not disappoint. The creme brulee corn and the potatoes Dominick was unreal. Great wine selection also

UdoFeb4TX_hTbfyt6wCd2A.text: Celebrated my Mother-in-law's birthday here last night and give Steak 44 the following break down: Oysters: 5 stars...mmmm...delish! Caesar salad: 1 star...wilted lettuce, lukewarm, lacked flavor.  Expected much better. Steak: 20 stars...so so so so amazingly delicious.  2 of us has petite filets, one had the Waygu special.  Huge steak ($110!!!). Lots of leftovers. Sides:  4 stars.  Potatoes Dominic were good, but better the 2nd day.  Brussel sprouts amazing!!  Onion straws and baked potatoes...good. Dessert: 5 stars...strawberry butter cake.  Wow.  That's all. Drinks: 2 cocktails were perfect.  Wine selection nice.  The recommendation made by our waitress was just perfect. Decor: 5 stars  Ambiance: 3 stars...music throughout was pop music.  Should have had something that matched the decor and "steakhouse" feel.  Made it extra noisy. Service:  4 stars. Good, what you would expect.  One in our group felt it could have been better given the price tag.  We would have liked to know the cost of the specials when the waitress gave us the rundown.  Were surprised with the $110 cost of the Waygu steak.  It was worth it though! We received the dessert free for a birthday treat.    We really wanted to try it for a special occasion.  Had fun and awesome steak, but probably won't go back given other steakhouse and high end options in the valley we've liked better.

RLpGpdNRr0OdjdPX6X5QwQ.text: We eat mostly vegetarian, but this place makes us want meat! We really enjoyed everything we ate here - filet mignon, bone-in filet, asparagus, mashed potatoes, salad, and our butter cake dessert. Service was really great as well!

1XJjKS7E3v8eEGj9MKK0Rw.text: Last night we was our first time dining at Steak 44 celebrating our wedding anniversary. Our expectations were meet beyond in words that we can put in words. Nick our waiter was so attentive and was wonderful. He made our celebration a very memorable one and we requested a booth and was surprised that we were seated by the kitchen. My husband really enjoyed this experience watching how the dishes were prepared. The manager came by which was nice to ask how we were enjoying our dinner and we told him that we been to other high end establishments but this was the best one that succeed them all. Thank you, Steak 44 for making our special occasion a very memorable evening. We will be back soon

NL2EtCYUvQPDLwgUCWsM3A.text: To start with, the positives.   GREAT steak.   Have no complaints, and done just as I asked for.    Side dishes were excellent.   A nice pour of whiskey for my drink.    My companion was quite pleased as well as it pertains to the food quality.     Negatives - I think the seating is a bit close for "fine dining," and the wait staff isn't too interested in you unless you're ordering the most expensive stuff on the menu.     My dinner companion and I were not all THAT hungry, and so we only spent $200.   Apparently that wasn't impressive enough for our waiter, who didn't even thank us when he picked up the signed slip and generous cash tip.    For as good as the food is, I do think it's a bit pricey there, and I'd rather spend $200 at Durant's for a little quieter atmosphere, more polite/less stuck-up service, and an all around better experience.    Which is what I'll do; despite the quality of the food, it's not better than Durant's, the service is snobbish, and the atmosphere is far too noisy.   I guess if we'd spent $500 by ordering the obscenely priced $195 entree we would have had more polite service.

WX7nr6a-CbXRB5RNgutlWg.text: Last night we went to Steak 44; it was my first time. The atmosphere is a little loud but the tables are round so you don't have to yell across to one another...you just intimately lean in to talk.  We ended up staying in the lounge area to eat.  I like to people watch and it certainly makes for a better time than a booth in a dining room.  I am still unsure who we saw at the table next to us but our bets are on, baseball player, BMX rider (that was Rich), or Rapper.  I didn't have enough alcohol to ask before he left.  We started off with a chef's choice seafood tower.  Sans oysters, we have  been out before and determined that we aren't so cool that we like the slurpy sounds that go along with a well shucked oyster.  We were amazed at the amount of seafood that we ended up with.  It is slightly misleading because it is more of "tower" on its side but a standing tower would require some scaffolding.  I was too full to eat steak and would have settled on just the company but I was peer pressured into a slab of beef.  Much like other first time pressure moments...I Liked It!  I am really glad that he did;  the steak was the perfect temp on the inside and melted like, "buttah" in my mouth. I would have to say everything was perfect except the Asparagus Fries.  I know right...how could something called "asparagus fries" not be yummy?  But they are battered so heavily that they come out sort of phallic.  It wasn't so offsetting that I didn't eat them.  But, the reality is that they were kind of blah; surprising since they were supposed to be seasoned with black pepper.  The potatoes were amaze balls and I would recommend them.   All in all, it was a fun evening and if asked if I would go again, I would say, "run that back."  In the end I have enough seafood leftovers (that they boxed and put in the cooler) and steak to feed a third world country or skip a few meals.  Well played.    #runthatback.

NRp0X3dhz3dG1Wxa84u0eA.text: I really like this place. I travel every week and to find a good restaurant is important to me, whether it is to have a few drinks after work or have a nice. quality dinner. I like the Vibe here, very busy and the Phoenix crowd is great !! I ordered the filet that was cooked perfectly and I loved the grilled snap peas. The only thing I had an issue with, if you could call it that, was that I bought a bottle of wine, that I took the remnants with me; however I had to pour a glass for myself at one time. With 4 bartenders it is all about service after you spend $125 for a bottle of wine, I should not have to pour my glass. Not a big deal but again, I should not have to with a place as classy as this.  I will certainly be back, my steak was the best !!!

Ov6avmu8ixepxYIlIrK0Tg.text: Phenomenal food and service! Great atmosphere and beautiful decor. A definite must if you're in the area. Everything was very very good!

GWUM-4tKaMScXUuI4iawWg.text: We wanted to dine here and brought friends who agreed it was great.  The only problem is there is too much food.  Two couples who frequently meet for dinner met here. Two of us started with martinis:  they were great but $19 each!  Salads were good though too large to finish.  We had wonderful steaks which some of us finished.  The leftovers will please our dog.  Sides were unnecessary so we probably shouldn't have ordered them.  Dessert was beignets which were tasty but too much.  Everything was great.  Service was wonderful  too. None of us is easily impressed but we agreed to overtip. This is a great place:  have dinner here.

91iUEf1TlgCl1rkDgM0HfQ.text: I don't normally write reviews but I felt compelled to after here. The food was great but the service was outstanding. The manager even called me the day after to see how my experience was. Would definitely recommend and I'll be coming back next time I'm in Phoenix.

Fn9kYHgqd2JPo212htyX2g.text: I love Steak 44. My wife and I had our anniversary dinner here last March, the food and service was exceptional. We took our family here for a wonderful Christmas Eve dinner this year and the service and food was again wonderful. I ordered the lamb chops which was cooked perfectly and very flavorful. I love the beignet tree it is a hidden gem.

uc_ces6cLxEuiUkvqZMLPg.text: This steakhouse was a phenomenal dining experience. Every dish I tried was absolutely flavorful and delicious! I had a petite filet for my main course and it was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. The sides were all quite tasty too. We shared the mushrooms, asparagus, lobster mac n cheese and truffle fries. Great ambiance, nicely decorated and a lovely dining experience!

mKBrOpKHfowGlPzmCQJKyQ.text: Exceptional service, food, and adult beverage selections. I would highly recommend going very hungry.

xsLg3rPDTm3lHnQVqmmTBg.text: This place would have got a 5 if we didn't have to wait due to the hostess forgetting about us. Amazing food.the steaks were cooked to perfection. The side dishes were amazing. We ordered too many! The waiter was friendly and the management totally made up for the waiting. We were treated to the heavenly dessert of the beignet tree! We will definitely go back. Make a reservation!

zjakMGZomlrDD5f8qXmAXw.text: My husband and I dined here for our 2nd anniversary and we will definitely be coming back! When I made our reservations I advised them it was our anniversary and asked for a quiet table, which they happily obliged! Our server, Sarah, was friendly and attentive the entire night, congratulated us on our anniversary and never let our glasses go less than half empty. I had the New York Strip and wild mushrooms and my husband tried the bone-in Rib-eye and the whipped potatoes, everything was absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection. I can't remember exactly what our desert was called but it was a delicious warmed butter cake with caramel and pecans which vanilla gelato, and they even wrote "happy 2nd anniversary" on our plate which was very sweet. The next day, they called to thank us for dining with them. This was one of the best dining experiences we have had in a long time and we are very happy we decided to celebrate such a wonderful day at Steak 44. Definitely recommend!

Y5Yjn4QjoytU9SkFwWrOzw.text: Great atmosphere, Darren our server was fantastic and the food was perfect!! We will be back when we come to town.

2pLo7gpGdTuphvqmR-LjXQ.text: Hands down my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. I have been twice, the food and service were both top notch. Great selection of drinks, seafood and steaks. The steaks have been cooked to perfection each time. No complaints here.

Wr1f8_nYQl4q3VRC8_IsiA.text: This place was AMAZING! Service was excellent and desert-red velvet pudding  was phenomenal. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best red velvet cake pudding.

pwd5zBKFqDtIOujH1yFFcA.text: Service was great, seating a little crowded. Table had bone-in filet, petite filet, lobster mashed potatoes, Mac and cheese. All were good but the steaks were over-salted. Butter cake was dry  but John brought us out a red velvet dessert that was great.

R9Udx68WsbzbYg2XDruUCQ.text: Great food, service, and atmosphere.  Crispy Shrimp, Deviled Eggs, Oysters, Supersalad, and Bone-in ribeye, all great.  Happy Hour till 6.  Great drink and food menu choices.

Kgj545FrKHtIXrnGeyVt6Q.text: best steak in AZ.  I am usually a ribeye fan but don't pass up the filet.

q2PcjdOe1kQqKZ7YWvHlxg.text: The food and service are outstanding.  Great atmosphere.  It does not get much better.  Right there with the best steak houses anywhere.

PxVf5MB9yn9PX7RCMiKMuA.text: The experience was stellar! This place makes you feel like your worth a million dollars! The food again stellar! Our steak, and sides were amazing. The sides are a-la-cart however they are large for 2-3 easily. Their Cesar salad was the best i have ever had, and i have eaten at G.Ramsey restaurants for comparison. The Service again stellar! Service you would expect form top rated restaurants. My wife would go to the restroom, some how the server would know that and come refill our waters, re-fold her napkin and de-crumb (not sure if there's a better word) the table. The drinks again stellar. My Grey Goose Dirty Martini was dialed into perfection, with almost another 1/2 serving in the shaker left with the drink at the table. The atmosphere and decor again stellar! The decor and architecture was very transitional leaning towards modern. Everything was clean, neat and pressed.   It was my birthday dinner and they even gave me a nice Happy Birthday handwritten and signed card from the Hostess and Server. (Not necessary, but definitely added to the feeling like a million bucks atmosphere.)  Can't wait to go back...

Z_WsbGlt-xQmXHvZnRaeVg.text: Nice atmosphere, polite staff, outstanding service. The food is on the higher end as far as pricing goes is concerned but worth every penny.

vte46cVJ6AJTh3ECLV1cdA.text: Amazing steak! And drinks! But don't get the meatloaf. Wife got it and it was not good. But overall this Place was great. pricey.

CJ8uFkNz0Y8Vjcb7uXEBRg.text: Went back again Thursday night, ordered the same meal.... Delicious!!! Wow!! Nothing more to say... Excellent service as well!

hj99lxUtvxqJjayB4cT0jA.text: Steak 44 was recommended by our hotel. It was outstanding. Great drinks, food and service. The restaurant called the next day  to inquire how we we enjoyed our meal.

2B0ljjcdm_qRnwE8qnESMA.text: Romantic atmosphere, the food was spectacular, and this customer service was top-notch.

usQXnPBA4aKVrnDkLbG_UA.text: The service is amazing! Great vibe, music, and the food is so tasty. Must get the scallops with corn brulee and the filet mignon with brussel sprouts. One of my favorite restaurants in the valley. Definitely make reservations. No complaints about this place. Great place to come for any occasion.

ZM5HJ_CG4OcFqs0dx5Wn7A.text: Absolutely ON POINT from the start. Previous Yelp recommendations caused us to try it! We got most of the suggested side dishes. Took home all except Mac and cheese. Really pleasant and attentive service from bartenders through the dining room: loved it.

5dd4A9vrdlEig4bjqiehAQ.text: Had Christmas business dinner last night and all I can say is Simply the BEST! This place puts any steak house around to shame. Well done from start to finish.

q_guTGhBLsQ3swhdcnqAkw.text: The 18 ounce Bone In Filet in phenomenal!  Service was great. Make sure you get reservations, as this place definitely gets busy. For desert, the Red Velvet Bread Pudding..............................

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red Velvet Bread Pudding
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bone in filet....

LpMCd0ee99wdA0F6DNL3Dg.text: My family had frequented the cork and cleaver and were so so sad when it burned down. We waited and waited for what new place would be resurrected... Well Steak 44 did not disappoint. We had a fantastic experience. The decor was modern and stylish , the food was absolutely amazing. From the warm bread, to the flavorful shrimp appetizer, and the Mac n cheese, creamed spinach and the del monte steak that we all shared was so delicious. The service from ever single person we encountered was above and beyond and so kind. We just sat in the bar!!! Amazing experience. Can't wait to go back! Next time I visit My hometown AZ from SD.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

G160iRxv1rGPNcb0idZOzg.text: Hit Steak 44 on a staycation in Scottsdale with my wife. We were headed to Mastro's and pretty excited about it, until our Uber drive told us about Steak 44. Thank you Uber driver! To put it simply, one of the best meals I have ever had. The service was outstanding. They sat us without a reservation (OK, it was a Monday night). The waitress was enthusiastic and took care of anything and everything we needed. The food stole the show. I was curious about the fried deviled eggs as an appetizer, and they were awesome. Our entrees included a 12 oz. Filet, cooked to perfection, and my wife had the crab legs (MP). I wish I had a picture of the crab legs. They were the biggest I have ever seen, spilling over the plate. They were prepared perfectly, and prepared to be enjoyed, with very little work involved. The sides were outstanding, as were the cocktails (old fashioned, wine). The timing of everything was on point. Steak 44 is without a doubt, our new, go to,"enjoy yourself" restaurant in all of the Phoenix/Valley area. Keep up the great work!

eBKfUNeusXUgDlUcaikRbQ.text: Absolutely delicious! Our waiter Ryan was amazing and the food was to die for. My favorite was the colossal shrimp! My eyes are still watering from the horseradish! If you are visiting or live in Phoenix you must try this place!

5pxz8GwHxcdybb6xIcuL_g.text: Food was delicious. Enjoyed oysters, crispy shrimp as appetizers then scallops and petite filet mignon for entrees and corn creme brulee as side. Bread was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Wonderful service from Hector. Looking forward to enjoying the food and service again!

HkYEl8kn7bS_cVR0og4tEg.text: Steak 44 has definitely grown on me over the years since it opened... it's a great spot for a splurge (both with the prices and the rich food) to celebrate a special occasion.  Steak 44 is definitely right up there with Mastro's / City Hall with more of a local feel, and it doesn't hurt that it's also super conveniently located close to my home.  You probably cannot go wrong with anything on the menu, but some of my personal favorites that I seem to order again and again are:  -Oysters -Chilean Sea Bass (although sometimes you may find they are out of it :( -Bone in Ribeye -Brussels Sprouts -Butter Cake  Everything on the menu is shareable.  I typically try to find someone I'm dining with who wants to split the ribeye or the sea bass and then share starters, sides and dessert.  Steak 44 makes a solid dirty martini and has an excellent wine list as well.  Service is attentive and professional, but if you ask for any recommendations, be prepared as you'll likely be sold on the highest priced item(s) - food and drink included.  Note... they also charge for their special ice balls.  (My husband can't seem to get over this!)    Their bread basket doesn't quite compare with Mastro's, and while their Butter Cake is amazing, I think I like the latter better too.  That being said, you cannot go wrong at Steak 44 and if you're wanting to go and looking for company, please let me know... you won't have to twist my arm to join!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heirloom tomato salad (split in half)

aRmiQjGaDWIFJ5Z3HgRRwg.text: All I can say is unbelievably good. Fresh oyster, beet and goat cheese appetizers. Rack of Lamb with Yukon gold whipped potatoes, sauteed mushrooms and roasted broccoli. Service was excellent

WcDB_6-Yv8LkzWvpAJ3Gzg.text: My husband and I celebrated our  10 years anniversary here. We enjoyed our dinner and the atmosphere , Thank you Steak 44 for going above and beyond taking care of us on our special day

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

S4L7uMMQxyPkdMTcfLZRTA.text: The food was good, the appetizers were great.  The staff needs training.  I was on a first time date or I would have lost it.  The booth has 3-walls for privacy.  The staff continuously interrupted. We just finished our appetizers and salad and a young man came by to clear the extra settings, we've been sitting for quite awhile.  The tables are long, so we had to hand him everything. The setting are full so it took him a couple of trips. So we sat there silent for quite awhile.  It's hard to explain how stupid it was, I really almost lost it. In hind sight, I should have asked him to have the manager come to clear the settings. They don't deserve all the 5-stars, other than my experience, they are good but not 5-star good.

65kqLTztmAlPlUxOO1Fffg.text: Ordered two steaks medium and one medium-rare plus all came out purple. Sent them back and they reheated the same steaks. So now who knows what they are, because they are cut in half. Asked the manager, he said that's what they do. So now sitting there with managers all around us while everyone is staring at us. They offered new ones but it was to uncomfortable to stay any longer. If they are trying to save a buck on reheating their steaks instead of making new one's, perhaps they should cook them right the first time.

w8_dnjFzHU0mytrgd6aa1A.text: We came there about 45 min early and they seated us right away. We got a good table. The place filled up quickly on a Friday night. Our waiter Josh was very professional. The atmosphere is such that you can have a business dinner, date, or special occasion.  I started with my usual Caesar salad. It was good and I liked the addition of a poached egg on top. It had a good amount of grated cheese on top. My friend got the superfoods salad and loved it.  The bone in filet (the smaller one) was amazing. It was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. We split four sides between three of us. The creme brulee corn was killer. The waiter recommended it and we added it at the last minute. Worth every calorie!! The roasted sweet potatoes with marshmallows was another hit. They didn't skimp on the sweet and gooey marshmallow cream on top of the savory potatoes. Both those sides would be a great addition to any Thanksgiving table.  The Brussels sprouts were ok. The creamy Mac and cheese was death-row-meal worthy! I ate way to much because everything was soooooo good.  We split dessert, the crispy banana split, which was also yummy and had enough ice cream and lots of whipped cream. It was one friend's birthday and they added a candle and wrote Happy Birthday on the plate.  Timing was a little off. It took awhile for my cocktail. I would wait to order my main dish until after the salad because the food came out fast. I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy Banana Split
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creamy Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Sweet Potatoes

Zg0rcpxyHiGCtq-4-ZV_BA.text: As a first timer here for a friends birthday dinner, I must say that I was amazed not only by the food, but by my awesome server Josh. Starting off the drinks we ordered were great, with just the perfect amount of alcohol in our cocktails. The peach ginger and the classic Moscow mules were a great start. I went light by ordering a 12oz Ny strip and it was so tender and juicy, the au jus that was with it gave it such a great flavor! Also, the sides we ordered (shareable) were kennebec potatoes, Mac and cheese, and creamed corn. ALL WERE BANGERS. The potatoes were crispy on the outside and nice and soft inside, the Mac and cheese was creamy and the creamed corn was just outstanding. As this was a birthday celebration, the dessert was on the house as we got the beignet that were perfect, paired with a vanilla glaze, and Nutella. Now for credit where it's due, the experience here was mostly because of our server Josh. He was amazing! He created a rapport with our table and quickly became a very friendly and personable server and showed us exceptional service. I never really write about servers unless it's REALLY good. So Josh is definitely a great one! I could tell he was from Chicago from his accent and we all quickly shared experiences. This is what customer service is about, more than feeling welcome, our table bonded very well with him as he recommend his favorites on the menu and what to get. I would definitely be going back because of him. Overall this place has an outstanding menu and service.  100% CERTIFIED BANGER

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ljgdmCrdjeCpZba7MT5PdA.text: Great bar staff and awesome Remy Martin 1738 Sidecar! Try the pork belly & shrimp cocktails apps!

9ChlmNTJcBhLfIGCuwWzRQ.text: Great steakhouse, awesome service. Free valet, single private restrooms, and bottle service. The NY strip with crunchy shrimp and creme brulee is where it's at. The beignets were off the hook yummy. Go here, you will not regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beignets so good
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creamed spinach, crab and shrimp mashed potatoes, creme brulee, 12 oz New York strip...all mouth watering
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is how you surf and turf

8TuCUE9nytwua43YvqDNHQ.text: This place is so AWESOME!! Was referred to Steak 44 by a staff member of the resort I was staying at, best recommendation ever. Totally was not hungry when I arrived after pigging out all week but I devoured everything that was put in front of me. From the house bread to the pork belly to the shrimp cocktail (a must have) to my cooked to perfection steak to the last bite of butter cake, everything was awesome. Will definitely recommend and have already done so. Can't wait to get back to Scottsdale to hit up Steak 44!!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super Colossal Shrimp Cocktail
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super Colossal Shrimp Cocktail (no joke!) and Braised Pork Belly!!

Nbk77m-zssDdAlHPV0ZJmA.text: I'll start by saying the food here is amazing. I probably had the best bone in filet of my life. It was tender, flavorful and the peppercorn truffle sauce paired with it perfectly. The experience I had is the reason for the 3 stars. We probably had the worst table in the restaurant. I was there to celebrate my birthday. The hostess knew this so I was expecting a much better table location. They sat us on the aisle across the rail from a table placed in the bar. It was like we were sharing dinner with strangers. Then when the manager came to their table to discuss their status, the conversation was so loud and annoying. He stayed there quite awhile with that couple. We literally had to wait until he left to continue our own conversation before we could hear each other.   When our  server (Megan)was taking my order, i  kept getting interrupted so someone could pass by her. Another annoying moment. Then when she took my husband's order, she asked him if we were sharing our entree. I was straight up insulted by the implication. My husband ordered the sea bass and was told, they were out. This should have been told to us when we were first given our menus.  Not after giving us ample time to decide what we wanted.  It was disappointing. He ended up picking the salmon as a last minute decision.   She also never came back to ask if we wanted a second drink. When another mgr came to clear our table my husband had to ask for another drink. When she brought his, she still didn't ask me, again, I had to ask her myself.   This experience left us feeling like our table was an afterthought. It was not the Birthday celebration I was expecting. It was extremely disappointing.

k5hep4wbJuBPY62cnjlU3Q.text: Absolutely the best ribeye I have ever had. We have been to many high end steak houses and none compare to this moist, charred, and flavorful steak. Melts in your mouth. The corn cream brulee was outstanding, along with the dinner rolls. The Mac and cheese wasn't a hit with us, but, we will definitely make the drive from Sedona more often for this steak.

eMBoLKLOH7FxNLKZWp_GKg.text: This was an amazing experience. We came here for our 1 year anniversary. When we arrived we were sat at a nice table in one of their back rooms. There was a card wishing us a happy anniversary from the manager. The staff was great. Answered all of our questions and made good recommendations based on what we wanted. I had the strip and my husband had the bone in ribeye. Both were good but the ribeye was excellent! We also had the loaded baked potato and the Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was creamy and we loved the different cheeses they used. Oh and the bread! They bring out fresh buns in a tiny cast iron skillet that are covered with butter, salt and parmesan cheese. We enjoyed the meal so much I didn't even take pictures. Would nightly recommend this. We enjoyed a free dessert in honor of our anniversary and took it to go! Amazing!

5i8nFdiMZ3FVj8VT_W3D3Q.text: I've come three times in the past year and still great service and wonderful food. (Follow-up voicemail is a nice personal touch). Sit in the back if you can or in one of the private booths. Will continue to return when I visit AZ, thanks for making each celebration as great as the next.

pDkz8uZXsH7cGswprLG9MA.text: The Best Steak I have ever experienced! Wow! I travel a great deal for business and pleasure and spend a decent amount of time at fine restaurants. I had the pleasure of finding Steak 44 the last time I was in PHX.  This place is the Real Deal. The atmosphere and service were Exceptional and the steak was absolutely SUPERB! I can honestly say that this was one of the best meals I have ever had and certainly the best tasting steak I have ever enjoyed. Can't wait to come back.

GKqi8XOcBM4RP9A3DehdkQ.text: I had the pleasure of taking my girlfriend to this steak house and I must say I had one of the best if not the best filets I've tried. The restaurant offers complimentary valet and has a classy look to it. The waitress that we had was very knowledgeable of her menu and recommended a variety of items. I had a cucumber mule and was very pleased with my cocktail. For my main dish I had a 12oz filet and my girlfriend had a 8oz both were ordered medium rare. The filets were served on a hot plate and we could still hear the steak sizzling as it was served. We also ordered their Mac and Cheese, whipped potatoes and their very delicious corn brulee. The steak had a very tasty chard and warm pink center. I'm glad I took my girlfriend because after wiping my plate clean I helped finish hers. I highly recommend you try this restaurant if you are in the mood for a quality steak. I will definitely be back next time I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

G5y4SKIw6EWtaXlgilxmKw.text: We were celebrating my husbands graduation from the culinary institute of Arizona. I had requested a desert for him as he is a diabetic. I called the day of our reservation. I received a call from the manager Rob who traveled to a local restaurant to see if he could get a diabetic desert because they didn't have one on the menu. He was not able to get one and was going to travel to another restaurant to see if he can find one. I said no thank you. We arrived in which my husband was given a congratulatory card. The executive chef (Chef Watson) came out to meet him and shake his hand. Chef Watson sent out two exemplary complementary appetizers and made a beautiful sugar free desert for the table. The Manager came to the table several times to check on us and our waitress definitely loved what she did. If you live in Phoenix and have not eaten at steak 44 you are doing it wrong. This was by far the best experience we have ever had and to top it all off the food was amazing. To Rob, Chef Wilson and Heather and all the other staff that took exceptional care of us. Thank you for making a special night perfect!

T-gtYfHwh0k53UXNzyfBBQ.text: This was by far the best steakhouse I have ever been too! Delicious.. well worth the money for a nice anniversary dinner. I started out with an Italian blood orange martini with was beautiful and flavorful. They brought us complementary bread rolls with garlic Parmesan seasoning. We ordered the braised pork belly for an appetizer, it was sweet and spicy very tasty. For entrees we a 22 oz bone in rib eye with truffle butter and on the side a double whipped baked potato with truffles and a 12 oz bone in filet also with truffle butter and a side of sweet creamed corn which the bruleed it was fantastic. They bring out the steaks on 500 degree plates sizzling and hot! Both steaks came out cooked to perfection at medium rare. For desert we had a warm vanilla Carmel cake topped with sugared pecans and vanilla gelato.   The service was exceptional. We got a seat right by the kitchen. It was fantastic. I Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an above average  steakhouse experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Warm vanilla Carmel cake with sugared pecans and vanilla gelato
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Local honey and Thai chili braised pork belly
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian blood orange martini

TgVgzY-LvheLb4tYrtuXKQ.text: I've been back twice now in the last month.  Both visits have been outstanding experiences.  The first visit was for happy hour.  Sitting at the bar is great people watching.  The bartenders are real pros and provide for great service.  I love the steak and fries happy hour dish.  It's delicious and just the right amount of food.  I was in a couple of weeks ago with some friends.  The service at our table in the bar area was outstanding.  In particular, Daniel was such a gracious host.  The bone-in ribeye was mouthwatering.  All the sides were great.  I also really enjoyed trying a couple of wines from their new wine menu.  To top it off, the beignets for dessert made me feel like I was in New Orleans.  Well done Steak 44!

UO-K5XRUpxUDq6pqZ3YaXw.text: What can I say?  First class...delicious...great customer service...delicious...amazing food...delicious...  Hubby and I had been wanting to come here for a while, so for my birthday dinner, here we are.  David was our server and he was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive.  First was the bread...it's freshly made with garlic butter and sea salt (you can get either one on it, we went with both).  It comes in a little skillet and is piping hot.  Yummy!  My dad always said, if the bread in a restaurant is good, the food will be, too.  So far, he's been right on the money with that!!  For our appetizers, hubby got the braised pork belly and I got the meatballs w/marinara...both were wonderful!  The pork belly has a little kick to it, but also a sweetness, which was very tasty.    Next, our entrees, hubby got the 12 oz. filet and I got the 8 oz. filet (I got sauteed bleu cheese on mine)...they were so perfectly cooked.  I barely needed the knife to cut through it, so tender.  Along with the main dishes, we each got a potato side...I got the roasted sweet potatoes and hubby got the crispy hasselbeck potato...and we shared the brussell sprouts.  All 3 sides were very, very good!!!  And, since it was my birthday, I got to choose a dessert, which we shared (cause we were stuffed!!).  I picked out the brioche chocolate chip bread pudding w/vanilla ice cream.  It was decadent and chocolatey and crispy on top and warm and so, so amazing!  If you haven't already noticed, we had an outstanding meal.  Everything from the greeting at the hostess stand to the friendly valet as we were leaving was perfect.  This is definitely a great place to go and I can't wait for another special evening to head back here.

iBDPItl7kmLMKi6Zmh7niA.text: Normally, I would give this restaurant 5 stars. We've been there 8 or 9 times over the last few years and last night was the first bad experience. If it had been our first time, we would never go back.  We were celebrating my and my mother in law's birthdays like we do every year. They acknowledged both celebrations when we were sat, but the waiter only acknowledged my mother in law's the rest of the night. The food was just plain bad. My filet mignon had a funny taste and was full of fat and tough to cut. My husband's was overcooked, and the cocktails were bad. Out waiter was MIA pretty much all night. At the end of the night a birthday dessert with candle was brought out to my mother in law but not me. By this point the evening was so sub par this was just funny.  We were just so disappointed because this place is always so good. $400 down the drain.

CJCkX0UBa6rrGKRVZRy-VQ.text: Extremely surprised by the great reviews and recommendations from friends. I chose this place to celebrate my friend's birthday and I was apologizing by the end of the night because of how bad the experience was. Maybe we just got really unlucky; the service from our waiter (Thorenzo) was beyond terrible, and the food was average at best. Went recently to another similar oyster bar/steakhouse and received the best service and the food was amazing. Won't return to Steak 44, or try Dominick's or Ocean 44 as I was planning.   PROS 1. The valet and hostess provided good service. 2. The guy who brought out the sizzling plates was working very hard. 3. Creamed corn and hasselback potatoes were good, Bone-in Kansas City strip was very tasty with a bit of a kick. Other food was not very good (see below).  CONS 1. Still waiting, 7 days later, for the call that I was told I'd receive from the Manager about our experience. Crickets. Why have the girl call and ask how your experience was and say the Manager will call, if there is no follow-through from the Manager? 2. Where to start with our waiter, Thorenzo, who made the whole experience pretty awful. He was so forgetful and didn't stop over at all (we had to get his attention anytime we needed something, such as placing our order), but he seemed to be paying a lot of attention to the 3 other tables around us. He was also not friendly whatsoever; seemed like it was painful for him to be doing his job. 3. We didn't receive bread even though we were told it would be "right out." Had to ask 2x before we received bread when other tables around us were on round 2 of bread 4. Forgot my friend's birthday dessert (the waiter realized when he brought us the bill and kindly comp'd the gelato my friend ordered for dessert). 5. Did NOT pack up all of the leftovers I wanted to take home. The next day I was pissed after thinking about spending almost $300 on dinner for the 2 of us to not even have 1/3 of my bone-in ribeye steak packed up and the truffle butter ($8) not packed up either. I wasn't even sure if the steak they packed up was mine because the amount was so much less than what I left on the plate.  6. It was SO hot in the restaurant. I know it's hot and humid this time of year in Phoenix, but it didn't seem like the A/C was working or low enough. When it kicked on it was nice, but it quickly went off and we were back to sweating (seriously sweating (not just clammy) inside of the restaurant). 7. The food: Raw oysters were room temperature so I was concerned about food poisoning, the bone-in ribeye was way more fatty than it should be, the bread was stale/dry.

aWW4bN3DDVxtC7odv2ot8g.text: Steak 44!  What a great name.  I got the opportunity to eat here on a recent business trip.  I was invited to attend with co-workers and customers.  I almost begged it off but glad I didn't!  Recently I have almost lost all faith in steak houses.  Most of my recent meals have been no where near the cost.  S44 is the complete opposite.  I would almost be willing to pay double for the steak I had here.    The meal started with some delicious Crispy Shrimp Deviled Eggs and the giant Shrimp Cocktail.    Next up was the salad course.  I ordered the wedge salad, one of my favorites.  It was topped with a great blue cheese dressing and lots of Bacon. All my favorites.    The main course!  The main event!  The thing we all were waiting for.  I ordered the NY Strip. I have moved away from Ribeye and Filet as the NY just has a better marble to it.  For a side dish I had the Creamed Spinach.    The steak arrived on a 500 degree sizzling plate floating in clarified butter!  The flesh was cooked to a perfect Medium Rare temperature.  The thickness of the steak was what impressed me the most.  They didn't skimp on meat!    The service was great. Food, outstanding.  Experience, perfect.    If I get asked to go back to Phoenix for work, even in the heat of summer, again, I will say yes, as long as I can go to Steak 44 for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. How meat should be butchered!
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The NY Strip and all the fixings!

uHu1uAP0IzPH6QiFyX9kwQ.text: Great spot for happy hour! Good vibe. On point and fun wait staff.   The bread is the best. You will end up eating a lot of those little buttery balls of bread. They are irresistible. For happy hour, I'd recommend the steak and fries AND the braised pork belly. You can't go wrong other than you will order it again while you sit there drinking either the lemon martini or double old fashioned. Pick one or both of these delectable drinks. They will be plenty to make the hour happier.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JjsRe8LrHWJdDfSxXL6gyA.text: I've heard great things about this restaurant so I decided to make a reservation and take my husband here for father's day.   We were able to get a table by the kitchen and it was very intimate. We started with the Parmesan bread. My husband ordered the rib eye, medium rare, and crispy hasselback potato, and I ordered the New York strip. I also ordered a side of mac and cheese as well. Everything was just so perfect. My husband really enjoyed his steak. When I usually order medium, it always comes out too done, however this was perfect. The mac and cheese was very creamy. The potato was such a huge portion. An entire potato.    This is a very elegant restaurant and I know most people said that it's not kid friendly. However, we did bring our 5 month old daughter. It was father's day and we weren't going to leave her with a sitter and my husband deserved a special evening for father's day. Customer service was very good, however there was no changing table in the men's restroom which was unfortunate. There was a unisex bathroom, which I'm not sure if there was one in there, but I would hope so. Overall it was a great experience and we would definitely come back.

f1YHo_Qyxh2unH1O2E83CQ.text: This was my first time at Steak44. I kept hearing great things about it so I decided to give it a try. We made reservations for 8:45PM. When we arrived it was a bit busy but not too bad. We waited about 20 minutes before we were finally seated. I definitely like the upscale atmosphere this restaurant has. The service started out a bit slow but it improved though the night. I felt the eating space was a bit tight where we were seated. Luckily, we had a nice group of people sitting beside us. As for the food...it was phenomenal! I also think it's worth mentioning that it was my friends birthday and the GM gave her a hand written birthday note and a free dessert. I'm definitely going visit here again. If you're ever in Phoenix and want excellent food along with a sophisticated atmosphere this is the spot!

gtqqXVOLp24W3gLR246v7w.text: My boyfriend made a dinner reservation here at 9pm on my birthday June 15th.   I'd have to say this place is by far the best I've had for a restaurant! I love how the manager left me a birthday card. That was so sweet of him. Our waiter was awesome. He checked on us often to make sure everything was great and he greeted me happy birthday which was nice of him.   Cocktails were yummy and I enjoyed my steak. It was so good I actually finished the whole thing without taking any left overs home. My bf had their porkchops. They also gave me a free dessert for my bday which was delicious.   Will be back next time. Thank you for making my birthday feel special!

k3i4rZ2gOVnewWbqumVfDg.text: The old adage "you get what you pay for" is most certainly hit or miss when it comes to dining out.  For every high dollar etherial experience (Binkley's comes to mind), there's a letdown (Ocotillo comes to mind).  And perhaps that's why it took so long for me to give Steak 44 a try.  This place is definitely a once in a blue moon splurge for those of us in the American middle class, but I knew that going in.  The real question for me was whether Steak 44 could live up to the hype behind its quality and its top notch service.  Finally, after being on my list for almost 2 years, I made the journey here for dinner on a Tuesday night.  Steak 44 occupies was used to be the home of Cork & Cleaver.  I'd actually been to Cork & Cleaver a number of times before they ultimately closed.  The restaurant today looks and feels nothing like its Cork & Cleaver days.  Distinctly refined, dimly lit, formal table cloths, dark accents throughout, and (at least today) a rotating assortment of 90s tunes playing in the background.  I was greeted warmly by the hostesses up front and treated like royalty by my waiter throughout the evening.  The Mastro family restaurant empire built this place and it seems this is the most popular of the Mastro brands here in the valley.  So let's eat.   As per tradition, I was immediately served with a skillet of freshly baked garlic bread to start.  Super soft with a buttery garlic texture on top to get the night started.  Next up, I needed a drink.  I opted for Steak 44's "Perfect" Manhattan.  Dry & sweet vermouth, Del Bac Classic whiskey, and a Luxardo cherry garnish.  They actually give you two servings with your drink order, for which I am most appreciative.  A lovely, smooth, easy drinking cocktail to get things started.  For my app, my waiter gave a strong endorsement to the King Crab & Avocado Stack.  Alaskan King Crab stacked atop a fried wanton, stacked atop a bed of avocado.  A relatively simple dish all things considered, but absolutely phenomenal.  A copious amount of crab and avocado with the wanton providing a great contrast with its crunchy texture.  For the main event, this is a steakhouse after all.  So I opted for a Petite Filet Mignon (medium-rare).  But I'd heard the crispy shrimp here is awesome so I ordered that as a topper for my steak.  Additionally, I went with a side of Chef Watson's Potatoes.  The shrimp is fried with sweet thai chili peppers and garlic aioli.  The potatoes are a mix of au gratin, caramelized onions, and a very liberal layer of gouda cheese.  In a word, perfect.  Steak was cooked perfectly.  The shrimp offered a crunchy seafood contrast with just a slight kick of heat.  And the potatoes were an endlessly savory, stick-to-your-ribs side.  Lastly, I had *just* enough room for a sweet finisher.  And my waiter advocated heavily for their Ultimate Warm Vanilla Caramel Cake.  Vanilla bean gelato atop a warm cake drenched with pecans and caramel sauce and whipped cream on the side.  The whipped cream on the side was admittedly strange, but the cake and gelato were fantastic.  A mix of warm cake and cold gelato with some crunchy savory notes from the toppings.  Not too sweet, but enough of a counterbalance to the steak to cleanse the palate and leave my tummy full and happy.  Total cost for the food, cocktail, tax, and tip came to $170.  Like I said, its a splurge destination (Yelp should label this as a $$$$ restaurant instead of $$$, by the way).  Still, if you've got the money to do this once (or every once in awhile), this place stacks up VERY favorably to other valley steakhouses I've been to.  It may not have the history of a Durant's or the glamour of a Ruth's Chris.  But Steak 44 is certainly worthy of the love it receives from the Yelp community and diners in general.  The food is outstanding, the service is top of the line, and the aesthetics are formal but relaxed.  The Mastros have clearly hit gold with their Arcadia neighborhood concept.  Even if this turns out to be my only visit, it was well worth the trouble.

0--fHtVo-GM198hp_fgaOA.text: Steak 44 is one of the premier steakhouses in the Phoenix area. At Steak 44, you'll find a beautiful classy white table cloth restaurant with a solid wine menu and a steak menu that of course comes with a seafood tower. To start, we had the calamari as well as burrata that were both decent starters. The seafood tower I'd say isn't as good as Mastros - comes with oysters (which tasted a bit off the night we were there) and crab legs (which were good). For steak, we shared a rib eye and filet. Loved the rib eye, well cooked and had a good amount of fat and truffle butter. The filet was ok tho I personally found it less flavorful than I wouldve expected. Service was excellent though. A quality place.

y_mfKFbBIKmky4Rm3eUCgg.text: Very excellent & high quality establishment. Service the night we were there was absolutely on point. Prompt, attentive & friendly. The restaurant can be rather loud, significantly loud, depending on where you're seated. You pay for the quality, but their shrimp are some of the best jumbo shrimp I've had in quite awhile. My wife loved the crab legs & we both loved the selection of sauces (especially their atomic horseradish). Flavor options/combinations are excellent & absolutely what I'd expect from a restaurant of this caliber. Our only knock on the bone-in filet was their house rub. Some of that may be on me for not reading/listening close enough, but I'd like to see it with just salt & pepper personally. Beyond that, the meat was excellent & mine was tender enough to cut with a fork. Very nice experience overall.

c_2F_xLS3QXKQ_qw-Jl48A.text: From the moment we valeted our Jeep to the our last step out the door this restaurant was perfect!   Hostesses were sweet, bartenders were great and our waiter Hector was one of the best I've ever had!  The food was amazing and the ambience just topped the night off!  We had the king crab legs which were sweeeeet & the bone in ribeye which melted in our mouths!  The creme brulee creamed corn was crazy delicious like nothing I've ever had before!  Beignets and vanilla caramel cake for dessert just made it all perfect! I don't rate many 5 stars but you MUST try this one!

ByVd45VC-zKrBl-QC3h8cQ.text: Amazing time celebrating our anniversary at Steak 44. They are amazing from the service to the food! We shared some oysters, which came with adorable tiny bottles of hot sauce, both of us had steak, mine the ny strip 12oz and his the KC strip, and shared some delicious sides, sweet potatoes and corn brulee. They even gave us an adorable card saying thanks for celebrating our anniversary with them! A great place to just feel fantastic!! I brought him here for his birthday a little over a year ago and we will keep coming back for all those special occasions!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

04hzEJwGSvUi4hyZNvz5zQ.text: My fiance took me here for my birthday on a splurge night and everything about it was awesome. We started with the crispy shrimp appetizer, which was covered with a delicious creamy sauce, and then for dinner had a perfect medium rare filet served on a hot plate and the whipped mashed potatoes. We also ordered a side of sweet corn, which I didn't like quite as much considering the distinct sweet cream taste but my fiance loved it. They also made me feel so incredibly special on my birthday with a birthday card upon being seated, copious happy birthday wishes from everyone from the waitress to the bus boys, and a complimentary AMAZING caramel cake a la mode to top the night off. A definite recommend for date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A happy birthday Ultimate Warm Vanilla Caramel Cake ! Yum!

AQp6Fm_UfBjbiq-uaPOm5w.text: Everything about this meal was outstanding!    The chilean sea bass was dreamy, heavenly, wonderful, and delectable in every way!  The regular filet mignon with a bleu cheese crust was melt in your mouth delicious!  Both are highly recommended... although I will probably let the filet stand on its own legs next time and skip the bleu cheese topping.  For sides, Chef Watson's potatoes and the creme corn creme brulee are recommended!  I suggest you stay away from the asparagus fries and just order a side of asparagus.  The brioche and chocolate chip bread pudding was perfection!  It was the BEST bread pudding I have ever had... anywhere!    *****FIVE STARS*****

ds9lpSs29U1ir6Pc1L06aw.text: When we first were seated, I was disappointed bc the table next to us was sooo loud we couldn't even hear ourselves. However, the waiter was very observant and moved us! Which helped us enjoy our anniversary. We started off with oysters from The west coast and the shrimp cocktail. The shrimp are HUGE! So order lightly! I ordered the petite filet and it was cooked to perfection! Probably one of the best steaks I've had! The dessert was also superb! Overall great experience!  It was definitely pricey, so if you're looking for an evening to celebrate but under 150$ this may not be the place for you. However the food and service were outstanding!

BxnYNfkqAx0oU0xhU3qp_w.text: We met a few of our friends yesterday for happy hour (Early Bar Menu available: 4 PM to 6 PM daily). We got there around 4:45pm and there were plenty of seats around the bar as well as high top tables.   My fiance and I ordered our drinks while we waited for our friends. I ordered the Double Old Fashioned (rocks - luxardo - muddled fresh fruit) while my fiance ordered the Lemon Martini (lemon infused vodka - fresh lemon - sugar rim). I'm usually not an old fashioned kind of gal but that one was delicious.   For food, we ordered the steak and fries (sliced filet mignon - parmesan truffle fries) and braised pork belly (local honey - sweet thai chili - sauteed spinach). I thoroughly enjoyed both. The best thing besides the company we were with was the yummy rolls. Again, I try to avoid carbs but I couldn't help myself. The rolls were airy and fluffy.   Service was quick and friendly.   We decided to rideshare there but Steak 44 offered complimentary valet if you decide to drive yourself.

Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Double old fashioned
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummiest rolls

mrHo_cHt3yCpl6jaWc32YQ.text: The best of the best.  Truly one of the best steakhouses in the valley, the combination of outstanding service, food, and ambiance truly makes this place one of the best dining experiences in the valley.  With my recent dining experience, I put Steak 44 over the top from Mastro's Ocean Club.  Bold statement?  Please let me indulge you......  So my our wedding anniversary is on May 15th and we were going to hit up our go to spot Mastro's Ocean Club, cause it's always been spectacular and you know exactly what you're going to get.  Excellent food, ambiance and service, so I was very pleasantly surprised that Steak 44 over delivered and exceeded my expectations.     We made a reservation on May 15th at 5:30 PM and were seated right away.  The place was pretty busy from the happy hour crowd and had a good energy to the place.  The only negative thing I will say is, our table was between two big groups and it got pretty loud at times, but that's something that can't be controlled.  The place is beautiful inside and you can see the kitchen and the fresh seafood that they have on display.  It's pretty impressive to say the least.  Food-For our appetizers we shared the Calamari & Shrimp and the heirloom tomato salad.  Both dishes were excellent, the calamari and shrimp were hot and well-seasoned and my wife really enjoyed the salad and was a big fan of the champagne vinaigrette that they used.  For our entrees I ordered the bone in ribeye, while she ordered the new York strip and we shared the crispy hasselback potato, sauteed sweet corn and roasted brussel sprouts.  The steaks were cooked perfectly, I ordered it medium-rare and the steak was absolutely on point.  The sides were very good as well.  For dessert, we planned on ordering something, but the waitress brought us over a complimentary butter cake with whipped cream.  It was delicious.  Overall, just a wonderful dining experience, and Steak 44 really delivered.  Service-The customer service we received truly made this place special.  From the greeting from the hostess, to the friendly waitress and even the manager checked on us to make sure everything was good, all top notch service that you would expect from a nice steakhouse.  The waitress was on top of her game, constantly checked on us, asked us how the dish turned out, and was very personable.  I even received a follow up phone call the next day, just checking in on my experience.  Thanks pretty impressive customer service right there.  You convinced me for sure.  I'll be adding a 5 star review for this place, and based off the previous reviews, it's not secret why this place is one of the best steakhouses in the Valley.  I would HIGHLY recommend this place for a wonderful dining experience.

5mv6sHWA9pH3JOjtXHNs-Q.text: The oysters are phenomenal!  I've been on an oyster kick after eating here and nothing compares, I don't even know why I keep trying.  The steak was melt in your mouth delicious.  The service was great, perhaps a little too good?  There was a lot of checking in which made it feel like the server was also on our date.  Didn't matter, the whole dinning experience was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DzMwEU8hXSgRdxiIZBqTGQ.text: This was the best steak I've had in as long as I can remember. This might actually be my all-time favorite steak for the cut I had (filet) - and I've eaten in fancy-schmancy steakhouses across the country.   Reasoning: I'm picky about the temperature and salting at every steakhouse I go to, and even those two elements alone are hard to master. When you're dropping hundreds of dollars on a meal, I don't think you should even need the salt + pepper shaker at the table; the food should be expertly seasoned. Everything was superbly done here. In addition, there was also a super juicy factor to the meat. Quite a nice and unexpected level of deliciousness. *This is not meant to sound condescending - only that I knew it would be good, and it was even higher than my expectations.   Other restaurant perks:   Masculine, sexy feel to the dining room.  Crab legs and fried deviled eggs, yum. My dirty Grey Goose martini was delicious + and it almost seemed endless (no drop left behind in the shakers) Excellent service as well.  Top notch. Will be back soon.

UdNjywLBv5HH-W8-LjvQ6g.text: Loved this place, was our first time and the staff were awesome. Came up to Phoenix early for a flight early the next morning and had dinner here - thanks John at the bar for the great food and wine reccomendations, and happy birthday!
