The service was great with the small exception of losing our waitress for a bit after we had ordered appetizers and we didn't order dinner for at least an hour after we sat down - wasn't really an issue but it did make for a three hour dinner.  Steak 44 has daunting selection of cocktails - my wife went with the Basil Cucumber Limeade at the suggestion of our server and said it was very nice - I a short but effective selection of beers kept me happy.  Prior to ordering apps a skillet of fresh baked rolls was delivered to the table and I began to get the idea that Steak 44 was cut from a different cloth - elevating a simple dinner roll is a great sign and I could have consumed the entire skillet full of these buttery soft yeasty rounds of bready goodness and yes I added even more butter.  We listened to our server on the starters and again not disappointed - the Fresh Burrata was four (i think) balls of the silky soft mozzarella relative with a just firm shell encasing the smooth creamy interior cheese and with just a touch of the tomato jam it was a great start to the meal - only critique would be the crackers served with (while good on their own) didn't hold up to the spread of the cheese - maybe something with more body - but I would total get the app again.  Also ordered the Shrimp - four perfect shrimps were very good but the make your own cocktail sauce pushed them over the top - my friend didn't warn me - which was fine and funny - but know that the horseradish (was it Atomic??) will absolutely light you up - in a good way.  In addition to the steaks you would suspect - Steak 44 offers a  large array of seafood and that was my direction until I was advised to not overthink this (I do) and go with the steak and while I am sure the seafood is outstanding after eating the steak I can not argue.  I went petite filet while my wife tried the New York Strip and I would highly recommend both - charred, medium rare - delivered with a warm red center exactly as order on a smoking hot plate - both were basically carnivore perfection.  I supposed people order the "regular" size but honestly the 12 oz strip and 8 oz. filet were plenty especially given the sides. And about the sides - remember when I mentioned elevating over that standard - that was all three - a creamy spinach that feature three (seriously three) cheeses and Watson Potatoes with more cheeses in little square of potato heaven and Shishito Peppers that were blistered with sea salt and parm - you could make a fantastic meal out of their sides.  So we were completely stuffed - the apps, the steaks, the sides so of course we order dessert.  If you go to Steak 44 and do not get the Ultimate Warm Vanilla Caramel Cake you have erred in the most egregious manner - it is a decadent combination of cake served warm in its own little crock aside a mountain of airy (almost whipped cream) gelato - once combined it brought tears of dessert happiness to my eyes (pro tip - bourbon neat makes it even better).  So walked in dubious - left super impressed - services was great and while not cheap (especially the drink prices) the value seems commiserate with the quality of the experience.

LFMw7F1uKCCTDhllfRP8Xg.text: Delicious! Went here for my 30th and they were so accommodating. The food is amazing. Make a reservation for sure. Don't show up too early. I did that my first time there and had to stand by the bar. My feet were killing me. There's a creme brulee corn I think, it was great. Filet was wonderful. Dessert amazing. Very posh place. Pricy but worth it. I can't wait to return.

aDDWSLU9o8t1J0U2IB3b3A.text: Wow I am extremely disappointed in our visit over the weekend. I love this place and often enjoy the food, service, and atmosphere but they fell far short in all categories. I haven't been for close to a year so I don't know if this bad experience was a one time thing or there has been a monumental shift in the restaurant. It started bad with the watered down drinks then continued with the stagnant shrimp and tough overcooked steak.  I was embarrassed because I exclaimed the greatness of this place to my guest who was treating as this was a special occasion. After the dinner we talked about the experience and I genuinely felt bad because as you all know it's very expensive and I chose the spot. I will have to think long and hard about returning as the whole experience (and food) left a bad taste in my mouth. I wish I had my phone to show pictures of the food they looked as unappetizing as they tasted.  Whatever has changed here I surely hope they change it back to the way it was because justifying a few hundred dollar meal is very hard to do with this recent memory standing out in my head.

sFfBH6pdRg5-kErYbA7FTg.text: My fiance and I went for our anniversary dinner. The service was great and the food was delicious. I ordered Salmon and he ordered a steak with Mac and cheese and whipped potatoes which sides are in portions to share and they really are. Everything was so tasty down to our desert which they gave us for being there on our anniversary. A little pricey but definitely worth every dollar.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TfiNsOZ8c4w4kxW_KSfCYQ.text: Brought a date here after hearing all of the great reviews but the meal seemed way too small, and the shirt rib tasted dry & over cooked. For the price I'd recommend Mastros or Donovans. the complimentary butter cake however was outstanding.

Tro0kWicP1sB1N9zXZfoNQ.text: Bread.  Order the Bread.   Eat the Bread.  This is a prime spot and has a prestigous name around town. And they truly deserve it. The food is incredible, as well as their very friendly and experienced staff.   Honestly, the bread is the best bread in the state. I've never been to a restaurant who makes their bread in a clover type shape sitting in the hot pan perfectly every time. Its so soft and good and i personally crave it all the time.   If you want the most bang for your buck just order normally but commit to ordering at least 5 pans of bread. Why settle for any less, the best thing in the restaurant is free. So eat it and love it.

oiiH9hia_SsEB3TqZSelNg.text: 5-stars all the time, every time.  Went back Saturday for our 40th anniversary and again, for a special occasion or for any occasion, Steak 44 is an outstanding dining experience.  So far and away superior to Fleming's, Shula's or Ruth's Chris it's not even a fair comparison.  The service is impeccable, the menu is truly fantastic in it's variety and the food is absolutely amazing.  This time I ordered the veal chop and my wife ordered the scallops, both of which were cooked and seasoned to perfection.  And the corn creme brulee is to die for!    No matter where you live in/around the Phoenix area, Steak 44 is by far the best steak house...hands down.

dIlfCsGnSesy7j5aPBI3nQ.text: This place is definitely a must try at least once. The service is excellent! The steaks are juicy and flavorful. Crab cakes are melt in your mouth goodness. They offer endless selection of sides to go with your meal. Remember to save room for dessert. Out waiter gave us 3 complimentary desserts today for thanksgiving and that just put it over the top! Simply amazing food and service. Don't forget the oysters...so fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shishito peppers
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oysters; very fresh!
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab cakes and they don&#39;t skimp on crabs either.

HSzSIvojBEy1u0j6mXrCdg.text: This place was AWESOME!  Great service from the valet parking attendant to our servers. When walking to are table I felt like I was VIP the greeting were genuine and with smiles. The Filet 12oz was cook to perfection and side dishes were off the chart. The Sea Bass was the best I have ever tasted.... finally the dessert was worth waiting for. I can't remember the name , but it had ice cream, cake, caramel and nuts. So if you are looking for a place to go for that special occasion try Steak 44 You will not be disappointed!

z442YWtLrK1mnVI8Dywt1Q.text: Phenomenal is an understatement!! We came to Steak 44 because it was recommended by a friend. There is no better place to celebrate or have a date night. The food was OUTSTANDING. The customer service was AMAZING. The General Manager, Rob,came to our table and asked us how everything was and knew we came recommended. Nicholas, our server was very down to earth and knew exactly what to recommend. It's so great to see customer service alive and well! We are definitely coming back.

N1WGjydSuifpDZIqxBytlQ.text: The service here is great above and beyond any reasonable persons expectations, while here you will be waited on by a primary waiter as well as 2-3 "assistant waiters" who constantly refill water and make sure your place settings are in line 5 stars. Now onto the food, with the exception of the crispy shrimp (delicious) the food was average, I had the bone in rib eye and it was something I would expect from a lesser steak house. If looking for an amazing steak I would suggest Arrowhead Grill in Peoria or Preston's in Scottsdale not only are they amazing but come in slightly cheaper than Steak 44.

CVuuiucR8TKIMxlh3eWXhw.text: I have never had a more amazing dining experience than at Steak 44. Our server Stacy was over the top incredible. He was so knowledgeable about the menu without over compensating. All of the food ordered was incredible! Definitely can't wait to come back!

ykEew9-evump2Y4S9kHYFw.text: HANDS DOWN THE BEST RESTAURANT IVE EVER BEEN TOO!  I don't even know where to begin.  I am thinking of flying the four hours to phx just to go here again. The food was incredible.  The service was spot on and the atmosphere is so cool.   I cannot wait To go back Make sure to try the mac n cheese

r_DLFPH7xsVM05Ys4S7uRg.text: Fantastic service and great food.  Up there with the best high class steak houses I've enjoyed.  Great for both groups or an intimate special occasion.

kF-2wcnXCYJu-ezKW9KZ9g.text: I had the 12 oz bone in filet, which was perfectly cooked, as well as the cream corn brulee and seafood mash potatoes. A fantastic meal.

LqHxBws9k6qx2TE0sYgT6g.text: Disclaimer, I don't usually like steakhouses because of the prices. So, I thought for sure I wasn't going to like this place.   I went on a date night with the hubby. I was blown away by the ambiance. The restaurant was nice looking and seemed like they are always packed. The only complaint was it was too loud I could barely hear my husband talking. But I sure heard everyone else's conversation.  Hearing him didn't matter after we got our food :)     The food was amazing! I started with the chopped salad. It had artichoke - roasted red peppers - red onion - locally grown iceberg + romaine - parmesan (minus no parmesan and red onions) so delicious. Husband got the Super Food salad with baby arugula + kale - sriracha sunflower seeds - seasonal berries - goat cheese - champagne fig dressing.  I got the bone in ribeye and husband got the filet mignon.  Holy deliciousness! I have never been in love with a steak before and we go to a lot of Steakhouses because the husband loves them. We should have just ordered steak. We got pretty full. But... I'm not leaving out the best dessert and we got the red velvet bread pudding made with white chocolate - sweet cream cheese - vanilla gelato... OH MY GOODNESS :)    Our server was Megan and she was pretty awesome. We will be coming back once we save up some funds JK lol. It is to be expected to be crazy expensive. But worth it!!!!

KxNmrDgEi6GGDrOI0UzOyA.text: Wow. Best steak I have had in Arizona. My lovely wife and I were hosting an out of town friend who loves amazing food. We had been waiting for an opportunity to show off steak 44. We were all so impressed by our wonderful dinner.   We stared with the crispy shrimp. A touch of heat, crispy, tender shrimp with a sweet glaze. So good.   Their bread is super yummy. Soft, with crispy exterior with a nice yeast flavor.   We all had steak and shared our sides. Each steak was cooked to perfection.   My wife and I had NY strip. Perfectly cooked at med rare. Just melt in your mouth goodness with super beef flavor you don't get with a filet.   Our friend got the wagyu which he was very impressed with. He said it was as good or better then most steaks he's ever had.  We shared sweet corn, Creme Brulee corn, Hasselback potatoes, mashed potatoes and wild mushrooms. Wow all were so good.   We don't drink, but I know they have one of the best wine selections in the valley.   Service was world class. Not one mistake was made. The bathrooms were spotless. Wow what a great time. I really can't wait to come back.   Service 5/5. Food 5/5.

uR3KrhcXc8jq4GYPQuj1UQ.text: Simply said, I think I finally found my stake house in AZ. Welcome to me!! The wagyu is phenomenal

yGPrRHk1NK2a78_EymC0ug.text: Omg the food was so good I forgot my pics,  or maybe it was the fabulous martinis.  That though pricey are a martini and a half.  When go to most resteraunts the bar is the place to be. I love the artistry of watching bar tenders making there job an art. I can say this is True for steak 44.  Also at the bar you can sneak a peak at everyone elses plates. Now the name us steak 44 what I saw on peoples plates looked amazing. I'm not a steak person but seafood lovers have nothing to worry about the seafood choice is top of the line, sea bass,  scallops, salmon you will be fine. It's not cheap or moderate expect to pay top dollar but your getting top service and food. I'll be back hopefully remember to take the photo before I indulge.

RB93HVWhIEs8MkOHs1EkBQ.text: For the price the meal was only ok.  I was pretty disappointed with the quality of the dinner for what I expected.  I would not recommend to anyone and may not return.  There must be better places for dinner.

cH6J_64iG9ir6z2HlwX_3w.text: This is one of my favorites always good.  I usually rate based on food, service and environment and to get a 5 star review you must be amazing.  Best steak in AZ.  Enjoy.

gpWY7QW3b2s-TGBHhEQJMg.text: Steakhouse 44 just became our family's favorite steakhouse EVER. We are foodies and have eaten at excellent steakhouses around the country. Steakhouse 44 just surpassed our previous favorite, Quality Meats, in Manhattan. Why? Every aspect of our dining experience was exceptional.  Our server, Jessica, provided excellent menu advice and delivered attentive, personal service, a True professional.   My husband ordered oysters, both West Coast and East Coast, and declared them the freshest oysters he has ever had. The fried deviled eggs were amazing. Trust me. Just try them.   Steaks? Incredible. We had the NY strip, petit filet, and Kansas City bone in strip.   Side dishes were generous portions to share with your companions like I expect from steakhouses. These side dishes stood out for their unique preparation and every single one was delectable. No duds. Mac and cheese, mushrooms, hasselback potatoes, double baked truffle potato.   Dessert, because why not? The vanilla cake and chocolate chip bread pudding were perfect.   Lastly, amazing wine list and my husband had 3 different unique old fashioneds - his favorite had walnut bitters. Yum.   You must try Steakhouse 44. It is worth the expense. It is an experience you will always savor.

7YNSvX0PuT_RTh_zQsVFOQ.text: My mother treated my wife and I for our second anniversary/my birthday dinner. The atmosphere was amazing, the food was next level, and the drinks did not disapoint. I'm so glad we had a chance to celebrate at Steak 44. I cant say thank you enough to John B and the staff for making our night special. If you are looking to celebrate or have a nice dinner, I honestly would not recommend anywhere else.

xG-0jfqEwEBjroyj5YZleQ.text: Thanksgiving dinner was so delicious! Megan gave us white-glove excellent service, the food was incredibly satisfying. Both steak, and seafood did not disappoint. The staff is professional and accommodating. Love this place: please open one in LA!

AXFLHaPw6-ZA2EujHtd1wQ.text: This, my friends, is a high end steakhouse that lives up to all expectations.  My in-laws were in town and treated us for my husband's birthday. We had reservations for 5:15, and when we walked in at 5:10 we were immediately seated and met our server, Scott. He continued to give us extraordinary service all night.  For appetizers, we shared the buttered rolls that were included with the meal, as well as oysters and beet salad. We also shared a bottle of Merlot recommended by Scott, and it was excellent.  My main course was the Shetland Island braised salmon. Wow. Perfection. Along with that, I enjoyed the shared sides of mushrooms and Brussels sprouts. The thick-cut bacon with the Brussels sprouts was the real wow factor there! My 12-year-old son was quite happy with a side of macaroni and cheese (I'd love to know where the noodles come from!) and some fries. My husband rated his steak as among the best he has ever had.  Even though we were all about to explode from good food at that point, we had to share a dessert. My husband was kind enough to go with my preference off the dessert list: brioche and chocolate chip bread pudding.  This is up there with the best bread puddings I have ever had. The brioche had a wonderful texture and stayed in lovely big chunks. The top was kind of caramelized in a glorious way in addition to a drizzle of sea salt caramel, and there was a generous amount of semi-sweet chocolate chips (high quality, by the taste) throughout. A big scoop of vanilla bean ice cream topped it off. Thank goodness we were sharing that among four adults!  Steak 44 was a five-star experience in every way.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Birthday bread pudding; brioche with chocolate chips

gMvFnPeFhy_vyPSeQFG6mw.text: Of course it's hard to find a decent restaurant when you are not familiar with the area/restaurants... so we went on a limb and decided to give this place a try. WOW!!! So glad we did. We were seated at the bar, and first off much kudos to John. He went above and beyond; very approachable, nice, sincere. Then, we had the opportunity of having Amanda wait on us. The two of them were amazing. They truly made our dining experience memorable and exceptional. The food.... again, amazing!!!! Dining in many places around the world and even back home, the food was delicious. (And John's dirty martinis... perfection). Would *highly* recommend this place. Might just fly from Boston to enjoy this dining experience once more, or many times more. Keep up the great work; management- recognize John and Amanda!

0r0XUrZL1Vyo9rLVR75Q0w.text: We reserved a booth after reading reviews.  I'm so glad we did. The restaurant  has a very luxurious relaxing atmosphere, beautifully decorated. Our booth was private, large and relaxing ! We  received very special  service from everyone throughout our meal.  The manager stopped by several times to check on us!  Our appetizer was the crispy shrimp, which was slightly spicy and delicious. We also had the wedge salad.   Our steaks came sizzling and perfect ! I had the Brussels sprouts and my hubby had the french fries. Very good!  Nick who was a excellent server brought us a surprise dessert, which was very nice! Since we had ordered a carmel cake dessert to go. We didn't want to miss out on it!. But both of us were too full from the wonderful meal we just had.   I  cant wait to go back for a special occasion ! For another amazing dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aw the sizzle!

MOXUQKAdaDwwNAQjkqzLEw.text: Great atmosphere allot of celebrities, unfortunately this makes us second class citizens.  We had to wait an hour to be seated for our 9pm reservation because there were no tables ready.(for us). Menu similar to city hall but I would have to say the food was a step up. I had the chicken and would say it's much better then city hall so food wise I was impressed. However disappointed in the service and the wait as I had such high hopes for steak 44 based on what I had heard.

3tROinAUb_haxgo3XK4Pkw.text: 5 stars for exemplary service! We have always loved Steak 44 primarily for their steaks but on this occasion their service beat out the steak. We went for our 29th anniversary and our server was very sweet and helpful so she suggested the special which was a wagu steak which was large enough to split. Normally my husband's go to steak is the Kansas City strip but we decided to go with the wagu instead. When our waitress checked on us she was shocked to hear that my husband was disappointed in the steak having too much grizzle and not as much flavor as the Kansas City. Of course she and even the manager offered to replace our order with something different but we had eaten most of it at that point so we said we were happy and there no need for a change. Our side was the Brussels sprouts which is one of our favorites with crispy bacon pieces. For dessert we were offered a second dessert since they were going to give us a complimentary anniversary dessert anyway. We were served the warm vanilla caramel cake which is so delicious; it is a soft warm butter cake with warm caramel drizzled on top and candied pecans with a side of their awesome homemade whipped cream and we took the second one home to my mom.  When we received our bill not only had they given us the two complimentary desserts but they also didn't charge us for the steak which was very surprising to us. We will definitely be back.

5Spy9LoYWLpn3linDoOeMg.text: I was impressed with everything. Love the front house staff. Fantastic wait staff. Management is very attentive. Steak was fantastic.

t4fHy_PSZmeRTDSZ-zisrA.text: Last Friday, 2 of my friend and I had reservations in the cocktail area. There was energy and excitement in the atmosphere for a Friday night. We were seated and greeted in an appropriate amount of time. Our wait staff was professional and prompt. The food and cocktails were amazing. The service was top notch. After the meal we took a mini-tour of the restaurant. I can see so many occasions this place is fitting for. Anniversaries , birthdays, romantic dinners, and casual friends get together!  I will be back again with every visitor who comes to Arizona!  Entrees - Chilean Sea Bass                  NY strip                  Scallops                  Creamed spinach                   Lobster max n cheese   Appetizers - crispy shrimp. No room for dessert!

C9dAdfWGxZBxIGgF_WsTHw.text: We had dinner here when visiting Scottsdale in October. It was a hit with us immediately, starting with the ambiance and the friendly host staff that greets you. We had a drink in the bar before our reserved table was ready, and that was so fun. The clientele was lively and so were the bartenders and I enjoyed a very generously portioned martini that was perfectly shaken and not stirred ;). We had appetizers and salads and steaks for entrees and everything was absolutely perfect. We over-ordered so did not have room for dessert (could have been the gorging ourselves on the incredible parker house rolls!), so that's a good excuse to come back on our next visit. Wait staff was attentive and lovely.

C2C4mLDlP6iS5MumqGF-5Q.text: First time here, and to celebrate my birthday. The restaurant is gorgeous and very intimate. My husband and I ordered oysters to start and they were perfect. Ordered two steaks with a side of the truffle butter (an absolute MUST!), the creamy macaroni and cheese (I could have licked the plate clean,) and the crispy potatoes which were also delicious but unnecessary given that we were stuffed by that point.   Two reasons why I had to give the restaurant 3 stars. First, my filet was overcooked. Something I did not expect for a $50 steak. Second, a warning/reminder when the sizzling hot plates arrive would be great. My husband got butter splashed all over his shirt and we had to take it to the dry cleaner the next morning.   Our server was awesome and made some great recommendations. Despite a few speed bumps, I would give this restaurant another chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy potatoes with truffle butter
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Petite filet with creamy mac and cheese

M4EsIpaP-NAV7lsp1O35dw.text: Very similar to Masteros in the same tier of steakhouse. I highly suggest going to this one. While everyone was trying alcoholic drinks I went with the peanut butter milkshake that honestly might be one of my top 2 milkshakes I've ever had. Truly a delight all around.

81okkLJA5zfIzOi6rpiFZQ.text: Loved every moment of being at this restaurant. My girlfriend and I came to celebrate our three year anniversary and this place did not disappoint. We were congratulated on our anniversary by everyone we talked to at the restaurant. It was like they cared. They showed great hospitality. Our waiter had great knowledge of the menu. The food was amazing. I had the lamb chops, baked potatoes and spinach. My girlfriend had the NY Strip and mac and cheese. The portions were huge. We had enough food to take home for another meal which is not usually the case when going to restaurants like this. We enjoyed every bite and the meats were cooked to perfection. We are definitely considering making this our permanent anniversary spot. Definitely the Number 1 steakhouse in Phoenix

_0qO7twmcnSPPYao1x1RAQ.text: All I have to say is WOW. Drinks, appetizers, dinner, dessert, and staff were completely excellent! I was there celebrating mine, my fiance, father, and mother's birthdays(they live out of town and we all have summer birthdays)... We had a excellent time. I highly recommend and will be back!

Rhc4Nc7h0Ff76zBsB7qVAQ.text: Decor and layout of the booth was admirable. Service was great and accommodating.    I'm impressed that they left me a voice message the day after thanking me for coming in with my group.  That's the first from a fine steakhouse!   I had the staff recommend a wine for me that wasn't Napa county since it's close to me, a sweet Pinot and it had to have a cork for me to keep!  They have a variety of wine that starts from the fifties to a grand.  A grand - I was surprised. They met all that criteria I wanted from my wine after some thought and time.    The Wagyu Filet was the best filet that I have ever had that was a wagyu steak!  Medium rare is how it is done my way!  Always!  Superb taste.  Add on the side tasty potato and call it a fulfilling, treasured meal!  They tossed in cookies for the complimentary end.    I had a fine dining time here!    Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wagyu Filet Mignon Petite
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Potato
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Domestic Wagyu Filet

PALrnZz0a9VtGNsVdHORCg.text: IMPECCABLE, everything is always fantastic.  No details are over looked here from the service and servers to the yummy choices of beverages and of course the food.  Highly recommend.

sY9A_xQx0ZMBgnRMKhzt8w.text: One of the best tasting steaks I've had. Not only was the food fabulous but the service extended all expectations. Everything from the hostess stand to the bar and managers. If your looking for a fantastic dinner Steak 44 is where it's at.

1q-o1wV6uCEVLsIqdMplvA.text: My girls and I have been drooling over this menu for months. We planned a trip out from Southern California and made Steak 44 our #1 priority for dinner. From beginning to end, our experience was phenomenal. ENTIRE staff was on point and accommodating. Kristin was the bomb! Funny, witty, sweet, and knows her stuff! The 5 of us still haven't stopped talking about our experience. And the food.... Sooooooo soooooo sooooo good. Started with crispy shrimp deviled eggs. Oh yum! Steaks melt in our mouth. Corn creme brulee and crab mac n cheese are definitely worth a try. And that vanilla cake.....holler!!!!! Can't wait to come back!

dZ-Z5qXpTgPr_dnkGvMBXg.text: **This rating reflects the bar experience only**   I selected this location based off of the reviews and the distance from my hotel. My plan was to have a nice meal and cocktail at the bar as a solo diner, similar to my experiences at Mastro's or Dominick's. This was definitely on a different experience.   A noisy and busy is not an issue for me. I usually enjoy a popular location and lively crowd, which was my experience with this place. However, the only seat open was next to the service well and the bartender encouraged me to see there.  I felt waaay too close to the open fruit/garnish selections at the well. Also, the printer was right in front of me, to the point of the paper orders spilling out to my eating area. Then, the trash was replaced by an employee and placed right up against my right leg. Ya know, touching me. A garage can.   The bartenders were busy but not overloaded. They look their time to get to me and take my order. I had to ask for the cocktail and then a food menu, as they were not offered. I ordered a pomegranate martini and it was basically juice. I planned to eat but there just wasn't enough room and I wasn't experiencing great service. I decided to take my business elsewhere.  Maybe this place is better in the dining room but I'm not about to expose my future guests to subpar service.

S4w0rx2YRpSkilXdgCcJ6w.text: My fiancee and I dined here the other night and Steven was our server. Let me just say, he was incredible and made our experience probably the best I have ever had. Of course the food was amazing, but his energy and friendliness was unparalleled and made us with we could afford to come more often! Thank you again for your awesome service, Steven!

LOz9g0T-xTxDA5UOoDGaFg.text: Moving here from Chicago I was referred by my fiance excellent food excellent service excellent environment  my Personal stars   would be  6 above five

Gw6ELL1952tKaPhRNIxaGA.text: The best bone in rib eye ever tasted.  Full of fat, flavor, and charred perfectly on the outside.  Caesar salad excellent, light dressing with a pouched eggs.  Wine was expensive but top quality.  Mac and cheese tasted like cheese.  Deserts, my goodness.  The red velvet cake with cream cheese was decacant.  We ate every last bite.  Tip, the happy hour wines are not cheap, but they are the real deal, order a couple before dinner.  Service was spectacular.  This is perfect for a special occasion.

f4UpuCS3czmhlx6YzK_bPA.text: Positive - Simply amazing! Another great Fox concept restaurant. From the Valet- wait staff everyone was friendly and on point. The food was delicious. We ordered the huge Bone in Ribeye and Chesapeake Crab Cakes (loaded with crabmeat, not-breading). The wine list is extensive from $40-$2500 per bottle, entrees $40-$205 Caviar per oz. The Valets were running nonstop to deliver the cars. Negatives - very loud a lot of standing patrons and one intoxicated woman was in front of the place swearing to another person. Suggestions - Make a reservation and the dress code is resort CASUAL, "reminder" you are in Scottsdale!  5 Star, again absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

X46i3G495z28obNFz3V6sw.text: We've come here ever since they've opened and always recommend it to anyone wanting an amazing steak dinner with wonderful ambiance. We've never been disappointed and we enjoy the consistency from their service to the food. We have also hosted our Holiday Party here for our staff and it was very memorable thanks to their attention to detail and superb service. We really enjoy their drink selection and their menu has the perfect amount of items as to not be overwhelmed by options. Some of our favorites are the Heirloom Tomato Salad, Crispy Shrimp starter (or add it to a steak), New York Strip, Corn Creme brulee and we finish with their Vanilla Carmel Cake. It's our first choice for special occasions or just because.

ybsdT-8cu3XRPsM2L0Pkfg.text: My favorite steakhouse in Phoenix and the fact that it is so close by to my house makes it even better! (Camelback/Arcadia)  I've been here three times for various events and the service and food has always been spot on. It's a bit on the pricier end but Steak 44 is worth it.  My most recent trip opened up with the crispy shrimp, superfood salad and fresh burrata appetizers. The crispy shrimp I would have ordered as an entree elsewhere; perfectly fried and tossed with just the right amount of sauce. The superfood salad I thought was ordinary but nevertheless tasty. There's lot of salad and the presentation could have been better. Burrata was a heavenly bite of of crouton, pickled onion and fresh cheese.  Petite filet mignon was simply stunning! Perfectly flavored and melts in your mouth. Sugar snap peas were cooked perfectly. Chef Watson's potatoes were a bit on the heavy side but decadent.  The meal finished off with the ultimate vanilla caramel cake. Easily could have fed two people and the gelato and cake paired nicely.     The bartending staff has been there as a unit since Steak 44 has opened in 2014 and they are easily one of the friendliest and professional staff I've ever met in the industry. They'll take care of you and make great stiff drinks. (Shoutout to Lauren & Connor for becoming my friends that evening!)  If you like Steak, you'll like Steak 44.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheesy potatoes - tasty but a bit heavy
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sugar snap peas - perfect bite

ak55eER30MwjneBjUZVqzg.text: This is the third time I've been to Steak 44. The first and second time were incredible experiences. They sat us in a great spot that was quiet and the service was impeccable. Last night was quite a disappointment.. we were a party of 6 and was seated in a partial booth meant for a party of 4. Since it was so tight when the drinks came, the waiter spilt the olives and olive juice of a martini on me. Fortunately I was wearing a black dress! They came out with club soda and cloth napkins but we had to ask for a towel with water to get the stickiness off.   I understand that mistakes happen.. but we were hoping for some sort of reimbursement with the check. Whether it was my drink paid for or maybe a free desert, even an apology from the manager would've been nice... I expected more for an establishment Steak 44 claims itself to be.

NS-ts-q_Kvv3Y5V2GH518g.text: My friend found this place on Yelp on a whim and BOY am I glad to have come here to celebrate my 25th birthday. It's definitely a $$$ spot, but you're getting premium cuts of steaks, chops, fresh seafood and delicious sides, so for special occassions, it's most definitely worthwhile. Come with a stacked wallet and an empty stomach!  I'm from California and I've had my share of steakhouses in the Bay Area, but never have I ever had steak that tasted SO GOOD in my life!!! It's unbelievable how awesome Steak 44 is, I really want to come back to Arizona and eat all of this delicious food over again!   All of their food was mouthwatering, and I mean everything was just cooked perfectly and deliciously seasoned. Here's the breakdown of the good good:  Steak: I tried three cuts while I was here because my friends and I sampled each other's food. By far, my favorite is definitely the rib eye. Rib eye is more on the fatty side. When it's cooked with the bone, it is extremely flavorful, fatty and tender. The meat really should be enjoyed rare to medium rare, there's no better way to eat it. Second favorite of mine has to be the filet mignon. You can't go wrong with that cut. It's less fatty than the ribeye but it's very tender as well. The New York Strip was the last one I tried. Of the three, it was my third favorite. Don't get me wrong, it was all REALLY GOOD. I mean you're getting high quality beef for a great price and many different cuts, I can't complain about any of it!!   Add-ons: Add different types of butter to the top of your steak for MAXIMUM flavor! There's truffle butter (damnit Nicki Minaj, had to go and ruin this for everyone), blue cheese, and black truffle green pepperorn. You can make it a full on surf-and-turf dinner by including lobster tail for $38, crab cakes for $16. For fancier people, $18 for that foie gras. Didn't get to try the add-ons but if I'm looking to go all out next time, you'll definitely catch me on that fancier side.   Seafood: Oysters available on the half shell - Blue Points, Kumamotos and the Kusshis. Blue Point Oysters are probably the bigger ones of the three. $4 each and its serve with mignonette, horseradish, cocktail sauce and not quite sure what the last one was. Comes with minature tabasco sauces, so cute!  Appetizers: Braised pork belly was one of my ultimate favorites of the night. Glazed with honey and chili, the pork belly was sweet and juicy. And the bed of spinach below absorbed all that wonderful flavor, it was a hefty bite no doubt.   Sides:  Mac and Cheese - I could eat this easily on its own! I like my Mac and Cheese chunky and not watery so this is cheesy melted perfection.  Creamed Spinach - you really can't enjoy steak without a large fill of creamy and rich spinach. Crispy Hassleback Potato - I mean, to be able to get crispy edges and keep the middle soft and cooked perfectly? TEACH ME YOUR WAYS!!! Roasted Brussels Sprouts - mmmmmmmm bacon and brussel sprouts has to be the most perfect pairing in the whole world.  Creme Brulee Corn - THIS IS THE ABSOLUTE BEST. Creamy corn with a little sugary crust, torched beautifully so the sugar hardens, I can even.....  I left the restaurant smiling and ultimately satisfied. Had to take a lot of the food home because I was simply stuffed to the max. This was one of the best meals I've had and my friends and I each stared at each other in disbelief while we ate the delicious food. Looking forward to the next time I'm in Arizona again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best potato ever!! Crispy edges and soft and tender middle
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Belly with Honey Glaze and Sweet Chili on a bed of Garlic Spinach. So tender and flavorful!
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oysters on the half shell, a little pricey but look at the cute Tabasco!

5DIhEcqLl1DaPCUpxbsNLQ.text: Wow, what an amazing night. My wife celebrated her 29th birthday again and we had a blast. Service was phenomenal and the steaks we had were exceptional, as was all thr food. We will be back again.

0kCMD30Jl1XSBlbaO2rQBQ.text: Steak 44 is an upscale American Steakhouse. My review is only for for the 4-6pm early Happy Hour at the bar.  As we entered the valet ran to the door to open it for us. We were quickly greeted and we grabbed seats at the bar. The bartender was very welcoming and we started with Happy Hour Priced Wines ($8.00) that were large pours. We split a BLT Wedge Salad ($12.00) and the smaller order of Panko Crusted Deviled Eggs ($8.00). Soon someone drops off a big skillet of Hot Steamy Parmesan Herbed Rolls (6 rolls) to us....Then the salad and eggs arrive with a change of silverware. The salad was rich creamy and very satisfying and the chilled silverware made it seem more special. The eggs were tasty and seemed free of oil and were rich and creamy inside. It seemed weird to dip them in Sriracha Aioli but they were even tastier after that. By the time we had 1/2 salad, 1/2 the deviled eggs and a roll each we almost didn't need dinner. But we came here for the $10.00 Filet Mignon with Parmesan Truffle Fries. (silverware is changed again) Soon our steaks arrive. It's a just perfect size for us....looks like 4oz...that is how much steak I would eat at home and I also have enough to save a few bites for my dogs. I thought my steak leaned more towards medium rare than the medium I asked for but accepted it anyway. It was delicious, flavorful and tender like butter. The fries were light with a thin crisp exterior and a fluffy middle and were nicely seasoned.   I felt 5 star satisfied.  The $10.00 Filet Mignon with Truffle Parmesan Fries at Steak 44 is (or was) one of the best kept secrets in Metro Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. WOO HOO $10.00 Filet Mignon with Truffle Parm Fries
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 1/2 BLT Wedge with (Sm)Panko Crusted Deviled Eggs
Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary Hot Steamy Herbed Parmesan Rolls

NcsnEe2_OkI-_KJ9o8F5fw.text: I don't even know where to begin with this review! Our Steak 44 experience was literally off of the charts. Pricey, but worth it. I made my reservation online and mentioned that we were celebrating my fiance's new job in the notes. We had barely even gotten through the door before they said CONGRATS and welcomed us with big smiles! He was so happy!   We got there a little early so that we could partake in their Happy Hour drinks + eats in the bar before dinner. Their martinis are delicious and they give you the shaker so it really ends up being almost 2 drinks! We had their giant shrimp {pricey but oh so good!} and their king crab and avocado stack - holy YUM!   For dinner, the service was exceptional. EVERYONE in the restaurant knew our names. I literally got up to go to the restroom and slightly bumped into one of the servers {not our server} and he kindly said "oh, i'm sorry Hailey!". I thought to myself, how does HE know my name?! Now that is world-class, folks! Ok, ok, enough about the service -THE FOOD! We ordered an inexpensive bottle of wine to start {~$35} and then their beet salad and chopped salad; oh my goodness, the beet salad was divine. They definitely go heavy on the beets, which we love!! For dinner we split the scallops and a NY strip steak - both literally melted in our mouths. I highly recommend doing this! For sides, we had their truffle double baked potato and the shishito peppers. The potato was so rich and creamy that we each only had 1/4 of it, leaving 1/2 to take home! The peppers were incredible, with the perfect amount of kick.   THEN, since we were celebrating Ben's new job, they brought out not 1, but 2 heavenly desserts! We came home with multiple to-go bags but they made for another great dinner at home! Thank you so much for the world-class experience, Steak 44! You are our new go-to celebration spot! Whether you are looking to impress clients, celebrate something special, or just spoil yourself - Steak 44 is a must.

QjRXrtUN3GGcAbmI4T_T4g.text: The Bone-in-Ribeye had to be the absolute best steak I have ever had in my life. The atmosphere was really great and the wait staff was the BEST I have come across. Please treat yourself if you're ever in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Bone-in-Ribeye from Steak 44

5EMC-GxkZxWK7eZ67uqzqw.text: Came here with a larger group Friday night. The restaurant is beautiful, the staff was amazing, and the wonderful taste of the food still sits on my tongue.  We ordered a bunch of appetizers to share for the table, including meatballs, calamari, and, my favorite, the seafood tower. It's rare to get this quality of sea food in Phoenix. I then had the meatloaf afterwards and savored every single bite. Perhaps it was my misunderstanding, but I was a bit disappointed that it was a la carte and didn't come with a single thing on the side.  The only reason I can't award 5 stars right now is because of the initial seating experience. As the first in my group to arrive with a reservation, I was told I was the first one to check in and that's it - no indication of how long I'd have to wait, whether we needed our whole party to sit, etc. Instead, I just stood around waiting. When the entire party showed up, we were finally given some attention and offered 2 circular tables pushed together in the bar area or our reserved group of 8. I would have hoped for more for a larger party that had made a reservation and was sat a good 15 minutes after the reservation time.  That said, the experience afterwards was amazing. I'll definitely be coming back again soon and hope to award the final star!

KLtf2vSxvBlmlRYPBgmTCQ.text: The Mastro Family really knows how to bring food to table!  We dined at Steak 44 last night and had a fantastic experience!  The Host, Brett, was so accommodating to us and where we wanted to be seated.  Once seated our server immediately came over to us and asked us if we would like to look at a wine list or drink menu.  We decided on a nice bottle of Amarone and she didn't waste any time in bringing it to us.  We started with the Deviled Eggs with crispy shrimp (Ocean 44 also has them on their menu....another 5 star restaurant) and the Heirloom Tomato Salad with Feta cheese.  Only one word to describe both, "DELICIOUS "!!! Oh and speaking of delicious their bread is off the charts!  We both had filet mignon 8oz for me and 12oz for my husband. They bring it out on a plate that is sizzling hot!  Both steaks were cooked to perfection.  Our sides were broccoli and yummy wild mushrooms.  From the ambiance to the service and quality of food this place is at the top of the list.  Don't even waste your time at Mastro's City Hall originally founded and opened by the Mastro Family but now owned by Landry's.  Go directly to Steak 44!!!

yAZNDaoWWVJs514oGUfKkg.text: The best steak in town and thats saying a lot in this town! Very cool ambiance and decor. Easily the coolest thing about the immediate area.

jFXN6G2KXEh1P96WUqzlsA.text: Excellent food, service, and atmosphere. We love going here for special events. We always have a consistent dining experience which is why we always return.   Entrees: the filet Oscar style and sea bass are amazing. My sea bass was practically butter.   Sides: Mac and cheese and potatoes are awesome.   The only negative things we've experience here are the asparagus fried. Yuck! It tasted like a corn dog with asparagus.

TtLougnYfYW7tiLGHerxbg.text: Well, we got there, of course they had complimentary valet service. Once we got inside, we were seated almost immediately and our hostess was very nice and sweet to get us a private booth for the night and we had this amazing view of the kitchen. Once we got seated it just kind of got awkward from there, our waiter came off the wrong way with us, I think he might have even mumbled something derogatory towards my wife. Never once did he smile, but he did get the job done, for that I will commend him for living his shallow, dull life style. Other than that, my steak came in sizzling and was cooked to perfection, I absolutely have no complaints about the food as it was perfect to my liking. Once we finished the night we left, and everyone was literally lining up to thank us and to have a good night. I'd totally be back, if I got a different waiter/waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak 44 - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1WK9dwFn_MMo-GYzB--Z0w.text: Amazing place. We were impressed with the food and team. Especially our server, Frazier, he was amazing. I would suggest requesting him on your next visit.

MaolGxhjGseFBbwdw_D2lA.text: What use to be a really great place for steak in town now has turned into fair at best. This is always a go to place for business dinners and service in the past has always been spot on. 5 of us in our group tonight - all 5 ordered steak. Asked for medium plus on my bone in ribeye. Mine came out completely raw in the middle. Spoke with my waiter he says "let me look back to see how you wanted it cooked." I said I did not order a raw steak. It was rushed back to the kitchen to be reheated and the manager brought over a clean plate so that I could dine of the sides that we ordered. Waiter came back and did apologize and agreed the steak was raw. A free dessert was brought out as a sorry.  I did appreciate that. Here is where it turned downhill for me. Waiter brings me the check and I pay and sign the receipt. Now I am with customers discussing business and they start to bus the table pretty quickly. The waiter comes by and says thank you, picks up the signed receipt. Our table was next to the computer terminal, I see our waiter open up and looked to see what his tip was. This really ticked me off. Service was subpar at best from him all night long and I still left 20% Not really sure if I will be going back. Apps - really good, sides decent, steak...fair at best and not worth the high prices they charge.  Not happy that the waiter was more concerned about his tip then providing great customer service which use to be the priority here.

210sINbf0hWYzKNDSmFkkw.text: This was a very nice place.  Crisp white linens, clean glassware, and attentive service. There was always someone making sure we had enough water& a clean space as finish our plates. The food was delicious& cooked to order. The only dishes I would not order again is the king crab avocado stack appetizer & crab& shrimp mac&cheese. The proportion of crab to avocado was off. Too little crab that you ended up with spoonfuls of only avocado which was weird &not very pleasant. Don't get me wrong.  I love avocado but in plain spoonfuls it is hard to eat. The mac & cheese was good but not as good as to justify the price.   Loved the ribeye & brussel sprouts. And the service was amazing. The only reason this is not a 5 star is because the dining area is really really dark. The lights are so dim that it was really hard to see each other's faces across the table & we even had to use our cell phone flashlights to read the menu.

28NJqwhIHtjdLM8VdaG5bg.text: I would like to add an addendum to my prior post. The GM of Steak 44, Rob Weisz, had contacted not only me, but 2 others in my party in a timely fashion to discuss our grievances about our dinning experiance. Although, I wasn't able to speak to him personally, he made multiple attempts on different platforms to reach us all. One of our party members took the lead and came to a resolution with Mr. Weisz. I am happy to share that the matter has been resolved in a kind and professional manner. Steak 44 and the managment care about the experience and also quality of product they produce. Thank you to Mr. Weisz for the attention to our grievance and for making every effort to extend the hospitality to invite us back for another dinning experiance. Thank you.

65X7dFUG5mGdn7IPmtQi5Q.text: This is the place to go for a special occasion or if you're just in the mood for a perfect steak. The atmosphere is lively with one of the best service in Phoenix. My favorite here is their cocktail shrimp and bone-in filet. Side dishes are kind of small, maybe because they're so tasty and I often want more.

uSwFhC3b7PIcb0GbNE5QZA.text: wow.wOW..WOW! From the walk to our table to the last bite - oh my...and yes please, may we have another reservation? Which is a recommend must (use your Open Table App) - chef is astute at cooking for those w/food allergies.

LgPPR638kxBjNCh3n1ymiw.text: Had a good date night with the wife we usually eat at Dominick's so we were eager to try here and it was just as good

saqLaVVs5B2M5xOGWVi8rg.text: Excellent food and service. Best meal EVER! My wife who is not a big steak person loved it. Our waiter, Nick Stevenson, was FANTASTIC! Great experience and definitely my new birthday dinner restaurant.

uEJlhajsl6WPdIQM0o7vHA.text: Came here with the fiancee great steaks and great people. The service here is impeccable our waiter Darren was on top of everything, he explained the menu very clearly. He just knows his stuff and when you do come to a steakhouse just order the NY STRIP which was really good. The price and the place is worth if you are in the area.

TNjAplCkDI8EPIXQz79jVA.text: We decided to come here for my birthday. My son was dying to come here. So what the heck I made the reservations on Open Table. When you walk into the door the hostess stand is right there so they are able to greet you right away. Very friendly. Very accommodating. We had to wait a few minutes so they could get are table ready. As we walked to our table, we went by the kitchen. The kitchen is enclosed in glass so you can see them working. One thing interesting is that their seafood is on display just like a grocery store. Very fresh and they ship it in every day.   Anyways, our table was semi-private booth for six. The booth was enclosed with glass walls. Very interesting and intimate.   The server was really friendly and was quick to bring our drinks. Always filling our water cups without asking. Anyways, we started off with their hot bread. It was so good. So fresh. Really good.   So I ordered the 16oz ribeye and they always tell you don't touch your plate cause it's 500 degrees. We ordered so many side dishes. Let's see we ordered the sugar snap peas, roasted Brussels sprouts, crispy Hasselback potato, and then our server talked us in to the corn creme brulee. The ribeye was cooked perfectly. Really fresh. Juicy. Loved it and completely destroyed it. All of our sides were so good. We finished them all off. Loved the corn creme brulee really good and probably one of my favorites. The Brussels sprouts, snap peas, and Hasselback potato were right on. Can't go wrong with any of those sides.   My wife got the prime steakhouse meatloaf and I was able to share some. Thought it was really good. Really moist. Very flavorful with the gravy. One thing my wife did say was that it was a little dry cause they didn't provide enough gravy but she just had to ask for some extra gravy and  was good.   My son had the NY Strip and didn't complain. Destroyed it all. My daughter had the ribeye too (good taste just like her dad), and my mom had the Colorado lamb chops. I think she got like three or four chops. My son tried it and thought was a little dry but I didn't try it (no room otherwise I would have).   For dessert, since it was my birthday I got a free dessert. Not to sure but I'm thinking I ordered the warm butter cake. Had this before at Dominick's and it was really good with a side of fresh whip cream. Always a fan their butter cake. We also ordered their red velvet bread pudding. I thought it was good but their butter cake is the best.   I have to agree with all my Yelp friends that I prefer Steak 44 over Dominick's. Just seems more private and intimate. I loved this steakhouse. Great food. Exceptional service. Great atmosphere and a very very friendly and accommodating staff. I really had a great birthday dinner. We'll be back for sure.
